text: Andreas Kappes (23 December 1965 – 30 July 2018)Shock anafilattico per puntura di insetto: muore l’ex pro’ Kappes was a German cyclist. He was a professional from 1987 to 2009, active on the road and on the track. He had total 133 wins, and, as an amateur, represented West Germany at the 1984 Summer Olympics in Los Angeles, California. He was born in Bremen, Germany. Kappes died from anaphylaxis caused by an insect bite, aged 52. ==References== Category:1965 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from anaphylaxis Category:Olympians for Germany Category:German cyclists
title: Andreas Kappes
